summary: This bill, the 25th Anniversary of 9/11 Commemorative Coin Act, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins to mark the 25th anniversary of the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks. It specifies coin denominations ($5 gold and $1 silver), design requirements (including the inscription "Never Forget" and other standard inscriptions, with designs chosen in consultation with relevant organizations), and issuance details. Surcharges from coin sales will fund the National September 11 Memorial and Museum at the World Trade Center. The bill also includes provisions regarding financial assurances and limitations on the number of commemorative coin programs in a year.
